name: Methylphenidate

dosing.adult_maintenance: 18-54 mg/day (ER) or 20-60 mg/day (IR in divided doses)
dosing.notes: IR formulations taken 30 min before meals. ER products taken in the morning. Avoid late-afternoon dosing to prevent insomnia. Monitor BP and HR.

canadian_clinical.starting_dose: IR: 5 mg BID-TID. ER (Concerta/Biphentin): 18-36 mg each morning.
canadian_clinical.titration_schedule: Increase by 5-10 mg weekly (IR) or 18 mg weekly (ER) based on response and tolerability.
canadian_clinical.inpatient_strategy: Useful for diagnostic trials. Start IR 5 mg BID. Assess symptom response and cardiovascular parameters.
canadian_clinical.outpatient_strategy: Prefer ER for once-daily dosing and adherence. Titrate monthly; use symptom rating scales (e.g. ASRS) to track.
canadian_clinical.max_dose_practice: 60-80 mg/day in some adults (individual clinical judgment).

cautions.renal: Use with caution; limited data in severe renal impairment.
cautions.pregnancy: Avoid; limited human safety data. Discuss risk-benefit with patient.

warnings: Cardiovascular effects: increased BP and HR — contraindicated in structural cardiac abnormalities
Psychiatric adverse effects: exacerbation of anxiety, psychosis, mania
Abuse potential — Schedule III in Canada (controlled substance)
Growth monitoring recommended in pediatric patients
